According to the Texas Health and Safety: if a hospital review committee agrees to end life-sustaining care, the patient or their caregiver has 10 days to find another physician or facility before the hospital is no longer obligated to provide care.
The law defines: life-sustaining" treatment as treatment that sustains the life of a patient without which the patient will die, based on reasonable medical judgment.
